review:
Read this to clear any and every doubt regarding macs. Coming from a Windows
user!(Updated 02 November 2017)

I recently purchased this MacBook Pro to replace a 2011 year model and oh wow,
what a difference! The screen is certainly the best reason to upgrade in case
you are contemplating on doing this. With my old Macbook Pro I had to have the
screen at a particular angle to see the picture properly or to see colors
properly. Not so with this model. No matter how you have your screen angled,
you will see the picture accurately and it looks awesome.  
  
I am a web designer and programmer by profession and it's very important to me
to have a really good screen. The 15.4 inch size is wonderful and large enough
to do my job right. Any smaller and I would feel cramped probably. I do my
main work on my 27" iMac when it comes to doing graphic design work or
development but just for doing maintenance and upgrades on websites, using
Wordpress for example, I enjoy sitting on my couch with this laptop instead of
at my desk.  
  
The trackpad is simply awesome as well. Yesterday I had to fix something on my
neighbor's laptop, a Dell, and I got so frustrated because I'm so used to the
Macbook's trackpad. On this PC laptop you couldn't click anywhere on the
trackpad, only on the very bottom. Nor could I scroll up and down easily with
that thing. With the Macbook trackpad you can use multiple finger gestures,
for example just use two fingers simultaneously to scroll up or down. That is
so much more intuitive than that PC's trackpad. For that reason alone I would
switch from PC to a Mac. Not even mentioning working with Windows 10 versus OS
El Capitan. Who are these Windows developers anyway that can't make anything
straight forward?  
  
Now, I was very pleased that my new laptop already came with 16GB RAM. Most
laptops still come with only 8GB of RAM. I have 32GB on my iMac but I can't
say it's any faster than my new MacBook Pro.  
  
I have no negative comments on my Macbook Pro. Maybe it would have been nice
to have a touch screen as well, but I'm okay without that because I own the
iPad Pro 12.9" as well. You may wonder why I also got the MacBook Pro if I
already own the big iPad. The answer is: there are still many things that I
do, especially with my work, that are done easier on a real computer, but not
necessarily by having to sit in my office.  
  
BTW if you are comparing or debating between a Windows touch screen laptop
with a Macbook Pro without a touch screen. I will still recommend the Macbook
Pro hands down!!! If quality and ease of use is important to you, there is no
other choice.  
  
I use the iMac for creating and developing. I use my Macbook for personal
things and for simple updates and maintenance on websites. I use my iPad Pro
for entertainment, playing games, browsing amazon, traveling and much more. I
love having exactly the right type of device when and where I need it.  
  
I know this Macbook Pro doesn't come cheap. But think of it as making a good
investment. Macbook laptops last longer, hold better resale value, are of
extremely good quality, and will never let you down. Using the OS operating
system is a breeze.  
  
A quick story to end my review. A month ago a friend of mine who owned a
Lenovo laptop asked me to erase data from her laptop. I thought, no big deal
because how hard can it be? Well, it took me all day, just about. Of course
not being used to Windows 10 didn't help, but in order to perform certain
actions, I had to go all over the place on the computer to do them and often
the screen would freeze on me (something that never happens on my iMac or
Macbook). Nothing was straight forward. I kept having to ask Google how to do
the simplest of tasks and the answers were always complicated. You'd think the
control panel could handle all my requests but no, the Windows control panel
is nothing like Settings or Preferences on an Apple device. About the quality
of that Lenovo laptop itself. The screen wasn't half bad, I admit, but the
keyboard was AWFUL!!!!!! Each time I pressed on a key, the entire keyboard
moved down with it... it had a very plasticky and cheap feel.  
  
Get a Macbook Pro if you're in the market for a laptop. Even if you're coming
from a Windows device. The transition isn't all that bad. If you own an older
model of the Macbook Pro, I highly recommend upgrading because the screen will
blow you away and the speed of this laptop is unsurpassed.  
  
Tip: it's a really good idea to get a case for this beautiful laptop. I did
and it's fantastic. It was very easy to put on and it looks really cool!  
  
So what are you waiting for? Take it from a professional. Just get this
Macbook Pro!

First I should say its GREAT laptop.  
  
I was a windows user for 15years (from windows 98) for some who dont have
budget then windows is ok to have i dont blame windows is not good, For 30K
you get good usable laptop.  
  
I dont wanted to invest 1.5lac on just laptop it seems crazy to me and some
people around me. Some one asked " You get Royal Enfield with this budget" As
a UI designer this is "Royal Enfield" for me. I sit 14hr-15hr/day in front of
my Laptop so it should be very good and it should make thighs are very easy
and fast.  
  
I Took 4 months to decide to get this laptop and I will keep this minimum 5yrs  
  
GOOD  
\+ Mast (very good) OS  
\+ No hang, crash,(not even single time in 14months) as fast as new.  
\+ Fast boot  
\+ Excellent sleep mode: with 100% battery if you turn of the lid and open
after 10-12hr its will awake in 2sec. with 98% battery (I restart or shutdown
my Mac once in a month otherwise it will be always in sleep mode)  
\+ Fast application load time  
\+ No virus issue (I have not installed any antivirus app)  
\+ Good other feature if you have any other Apple products  
\+ Sooper Display and Sound  
\+ Very good battery backup / Fast charging  
\+ Good keyboard + Touch Pad (my use is less) ( have external keyboard and
mouse )  
\+ Fast copy and move the files  
\+ Lightweight  
  
\+ lots of other small things  
  
NOT GOOD  
\- Definitely a Price  
\- Only 2 USB  
\- Accessories are very costly  
\- Difficult to understand the OS initially as I was windows user for 15years
(I took 1month understand)  
  
If you are developer, Designer , Motion graphic design or 3D Animator then you
should have this with "No Regret".  
There is another updated version with Touch bar which is very similar in terms
of speed.  
  
Finally word Very good machine to have value for money. Hard earned money will
not be wasted.  
  
I bought it for Rs.1,46,500 + wired Keyboard Rs.3,500

I have been a Macbook pro user for last 2 years. I came across the new Macbook
air and got a chance to put hands on it. So here is a brief review on my first
impressions. Basically i will be comparing this with a regular laptop of
similar price range and Macbook PRO  
  
Air benefits compared to Non Apple laptop:  
# Slim and light weight for daily travel  
# 10-11 hours battery backup on normal usage  
# Apple touch pads are awesome, smooth and responsive compared to any premium
laptop  
# Audio quality on speakers is good, but not as loud as my Macbook Pro 13  
# Apple front camera works the best in low light, best for low light skype
calls  
# SSD - Apps launch very fast despite the low power processor  
# Metal body construction  
# Mag safe charger- If you are really careless this helps very much.  
# Ambient light sensor that adjusts brightness automatically ( Many people are
not aware of this feature)  
# Keep your Air closed or leave somewhere idle and check back after 2 or 3
days, you will see battery has dropped less than 3 or 4 %  
# The best part - Mac OS, contains all that you need, a neat calendar, Todos
app, notes, Quicktime, Mail app etc. Hassle free OS  
  
Air demerits compared to Non Apple laptop:  
# Performance is on lower side  
# Good for basic usage only, internet, movies, video calls, spreadsheets, mail  
# You will get better display(Full HD) if you buy a 999$ Ultrabook from US (In
India they come at premium)  
  
Should you consider Macbook PRO? - PRO advantages  
I know a lot of people might be confused whether to go with PRO for some
additional bucks. So listing benefits of pro from my experience  
  
# Force touch - More comfortable touch pad, less finger pain compared to
buttons on Air, Adjustable pressure  
# Retina display - More pixels, Better viewing angle. Air is 1440x900 while
PRO is 2560x1600 pixels  
# Better performance - Pro CPU is actually about 50% faster than AIR, but in
real world tests, apps launch at similar speed in both PRO and Air. The
difference is notable only when you run CPU intensive tasks like Programming,
Video encoding, Photo editing, Raw conversion etc. Those who are not into this
can go with Air and save some money.  
# Newer CPU - Macbook air has not evolved much compared to PRO. The 2017 Air
uses the same fifth generation CPU as the previous version (2015). But with a
little upgrade in CPU speed. ie 1.6 GHz to 1.8 GHz. The newer PROs come with
7th generation Intel processors. The difference is mainly with the energy
consumption.  
# HDMI port - You don't need display port adaptor  
# New keyboard - The 2016 PRO has the same keyboard as the "Macbook". Keys are
less deeper and more wider. This makes it little more comfortable to type. Air
comes with the same old keyboard as 2015 PRO  
# Wider touch pad - Not a big deal. But if someone loves that, its a bonus  
# Color options - Yes, Air is only available in Silver, PRO comes in 3 color
options  
  
If you think, all the above justifies the price difference between the PRO and
Air, go for the PRO. The only benefit that Air offers is battery life. PRO
offers 8-9 hours only, while Air offers, 11-12 hours battery.  
  
Whom Air is for?  
Macbook air is not a gaming machine or for hard core users. Its for people who
love to watch lot of movies, work on documents, browse and some basic
programming. When i say programming, Xcode works fine on Macbook air. But
Software like Android studio, Photoshop seems to struggle a little on Air. But
if you are once in a while user of intensive apps, you can ignore this.  
  
I will update my review with more details after a few weeks of hands on
testing and usage. If you have any queries leave a comment below. I will try
to answer in a day or two.  
  
[...]! Thank you :)

I bought this laptop one month ago and absolutely love it.  
  
This is my first Apple laptop, I have always been using Windows computers but
decided to take the plunge as it was recommended for a graphic design course I
am doing.  
  
Also please don't forget to buy from a fulfilled seller Copy and paste this
link in your browser <<\--here are all the recommended sellers .Else I can't
guarantee about the genuineness. Because there is too much fake apple products
online  
  
Where to start?  
  
1\. Design  
Very sleek and modern. Seems to be made from high quality material. It had the
new force touch pad, which is quite nice.  
  
The best thing about it, in my opinion, is the Retina screen, which is
absolutely superb. It really makes life more beautiful.  
  
The sound quality is great and so is battery life. I can work on it for an
entire day without needing to charge it.  
  
2\. Functionality  
Very fast and comes pre loaded with a lot of apps, including the Apple
equivalent of the Microsoft Office Suite.  
It takes a while to get used to it if you are switching from Windows but in my
experience it's quite an easy transition. Everything is intuitive and I didn't
have to check any manual or google anything once.  
  
In terms of performance, there's no lag and it operates very fast. I plan to
install the Adobe Suite, which I haven't yet. This is the reason why I bought
the 15 inch model over the 13 inch, as this one has a larger screen and a quad
core processor.  
  
3\. Price  
Well... ouch. It's much more expensive than any high end Windows laptop, but
in my opinion it is worth it. It delivers a unique experience and it screams
quality and attractive design.  
  
I will keep on using it and imagine that the more I learn the more informed an
opinion I will be able to have, but hope this helps you to begin with.

Superb masterpiece product by apple!  
  
Don't get fooled seeing the limited RAM or processor speed! This device is as
fast as any other gaming laptop found on the market.  
If your primary focus area is programming,video editing, don't look back. This
is a gem.  
However if you are into high end video editing, you may want to consider the
variant with the graphic card.  
The flash storage of 256 GB SSD is lightning fast. I have to open many apps at
once and I thought maybe 16GB RAM was a little less considering I used iMac
with 32 GB RAM.  
However it uses your SSD as RAM which is just as fast or maybe faster :P.  
Available storage is 230 GB.  
I would advise buying it from an official Apple Reseller where you can get a
good student discount also.

I am writing this review after using this extensively for last 10 days. I was
a Windows user and here are my initial feelings about this machine.  
  
Please note that I am a professional photographer, who uses Photo Shop and
Light Room extensively.  
  
1\. The display is just amazing. Coming from a Dell machine, the difference is
just awesome. My own photos look new and refreshing to me.  
  
2\. The laptop is an engineering marvel, the lid and base are crafted with
such precision and attention to detail that the lid can be opened without
lifting up the laptop in the process. Try doing that with any other Windows
laptop.  
  
3\. Keyboard is quite good. Not over the top, but is very comfortable.  
  
4\. The Force Touch mouse pad is just awesome. You won't need and external
mouse at all, even while doing photo editing. While I just cannot work without
a mouse in Windows, I have found that with MacBook you wouldn't miss an
external mouse at all.  
  
5\. The laptop does heat up quite fast.  
  
6\. Battery lasts up to 6 hours with normal usage, along with some amount of
Light Room or Photoshop. It definitely will not last for 10 hours as it is
being advertised.  
  
7\. It is very light and just the right size to carry around in your bag. At 2
kilos there is not much weight difference between Dell and MacBook  
  
8\. I got this older model so that I get all the ports including the SDHC port
for my camera cards, without which it would be quite useless.  
  
I am finding this machine up to my liking, but wish the battery could last
longer for heavy users like me.

This is the Best Macbook ever. You can't find any other macbook more than
these spec (expect 500 GB HDD model of same), i bought it in Feb 2016 still no
lag at all, It take hardly to 3-5 Sec start and you can instantly using any of
App within sec after that.  
If you are looking for a Gaming laptop then AlienWare is best in same Price
[but I am sure you will face windows corrupt problems at all] or If you don't
want to waste your single sec on hang or crash during your work then Go Buy
It.

This is my 3rd Macbook PRO since 2007. I found this the best value for money
than the 2016 model or any model I've used before.  
  
Before this I was using the 2011 model which used to heat up a bit too much
under heavy app usage. With this model, all my complains are gone! Even when
the charger is plugged-in and I'm running many apps there is no heating
problem.  
  
As for the battery, what can I say - I thought it was just a marketing ploy
when they said it lasts 9 hours of use, but the legend true! I'm genuinely
surprised that the battery lasts almost 9 hours every single time!  
  
Overall a great purchase, highly recommended.

review:
I was very skeptical to buy such an expensive laptop that too Mac online on
Amazon. But the experience has been just awesome. Just love this laptop. It is
worth every penny invested on it. Its super fast, superb battery backup, no
heating issues, no lag, amazing display and outstanding sound quality for the
laptop speakers. In fact I got with latest OS EL-CAPITAN. I was expecting the
older version as mentioned in the specs on this product. It was a very
pleasant surprise to receive the latest OS.

Before buying online I contacted the authorised dealer who frightened me that
online product might be refurbished. As refurbished products get a different
serial number, I could easily verify that the product is new and genuine.  
As expected with the apple products, you get the value for what you have paid.
Laptop is extremely good, particularly for a developer.

Got issue with laptop MLB sensor the next week after the expiry of warranty
with normal use. Apple Service centre is saying to replace the Logic Board
which is going to cost 60K INR. It is not about the seller. It is about the
apple product. The apple product quality is not like before.

This is a joke of a laptop. Unless you are a professional sound recording
artist or a designer who wants to render heavy designs or a video editor..
this laptop is not for you. You can get an Awsome Gaming laptop for the same
price and you also get to play latest games while this will struggle to play
games as it doesn't has dedicated graphics.  
  
So unless you are one of the above mentioned people, do not get it. No you can
not play games on it. Well technically you can but that needs windows to be
installed and still you won't get good FPS  
  
Yet the price is really high given that you can't upgrade your memory in
future as it's soldered to the motherboard.

The Computer is as usual to be vry good at all the work ( experience for 14
long yrs of apple laptops and phones )....smooth on the UI and in application
opening and closing....though u should be roaming with 1 lakh in ur wallet
because if ur Logic Unit gets faulty first u hv to deposit 2800 for just a
simple "check".....that's amazing way to earn while the Logic unit itself
costs a staggering 42000.....yes forty two thousand......if u hv money to
spend go ahead if not stay away because jst a check for any problem if ur
nutbolts r missing its 2800 and each bolt is 400 its made out of gold surely
apple......

Update (29/11/2016):  
  
I am updating this after using this gorgeous piece of tech for more than a
year and in my experience this is the best laptop I could ever own. From the
price point of view lets just be honest it costs way too much for a laptop but
again you get what you pay for, I know its a clichè but its true.

flash it was no longer an issue. I never ran into a problem where it got stuck
or I had to restart it because of some issue never have I had to take any such
steps which were frequent on my windows based dell laptop. Its the seemless
integration of Hardware and Software which makes this product a piece of art.
As Steve Jobs quoted during the first iPhone launch, "People who are serious
about software should make there own hardware" and this Macbook is the perfect
example.

I've been using it for over a month, and I loved it to the core. It's my first
Mac, and I've been skeptical about buying it because I was strictly a Windows
guy earlier. A little research later, I found myself willing to give it a try
and purchased it.  
  
I went for the 16gb version as I have some pretty intensive apps to run. Once
the memory clocked 14.9gb, but the performance was very very smooth. I found
no lag whatsoever, the usage is always quick and breezy.  
  
Sometimes my old Windows habits kick in, but I think it'll take some time to
adjust to the OS and work in tandem with it.  
  
The only disappointment I had was that there is no NVDIA graphic card. That,
given the price, would have made this product a truly incredible purchase.
Also I can't comment about the performance of games, as I rarely play games on
my PC.  
  
Others have done a great job describing the specs, so I don't want to go there
again.  
  
In all, go for it if you are a looking for a good platform to experiment
around, and your budget allows for it. I personally can see myself using it
for quite a long time.

First of all this is truly a beast of a laptop as suggested by other
reviewers, but cannot be said the same when it comes to gaming.  
I bought it and I don't have any regrets, just that I bought it from Paytm.
They also have sellers selling it for the same price as Amazon but the
advantage over there is that Paytm is offering good cash back amount, so
overall it should cost somewhere between 1.2lakh to 1.25lakh as of now, just
make sure that they are Brand Authorized Sellers.  
  
Pros:  
1\. Have Usb ports, which are missing from 2016 models  
2\. The performance is remarkable  
3\. Battery backup is up to the mark  
4\. One of the best when it comes for using applications that needs processing
and memory  
5\. It's slim and sleek as compared to other laptops (except MacBook pro 2016
and MacBook air ;) )  
  
Cons  
1\. Slightly Heavy  
2\. Can't be expected to perform in the same way as the other dedicated gaming
laptops.

The device is good, performs well but it's highly overrated. Here are some
things that disappointed me  
  
1\. Within 2 months the display has horizontal lines on them and it's
increasing every day. I've contacted the customer support and dropped it to a
service center and they say it's a hardware issue.  
2\. The animations stutter sometimes it might be a El Capitan issue but I
noticed it on Yosemite too right out of the box.  
3\. El capitan has a lot of bugs, widgets disappear. some apps kinda freeze
and needs restart.  
  
For a device that cost 140k this is really disappointing.

Awesome Performance!!!!!  
Are the only words coming out of my mouth when i m discussing about my mac
with others.Awesome Performance, Excellent Heat Management, Awesome Look, Very
light to carry(Comparing with same config lappy in the market), Great Screen
Colours...etc. I m a programmer, it is the best lappy for the programmers in
the planet it is taking around 2seconds to start with the development or any
processes in the system after staring the mac. Im using Android Studio,Android
Emulator,Xcode ,Iphone Emulator, VMware(Windows 7), Photoshop CC, Eclipse,
Netbeans at a time to test its ability but there is no lag in the performance.

[1] This is an older model compared to the existing mac. But its still great.
Although the specs don't seem too great for the price, its very efficient
(which means that it can do the same thing using lesser RAM).  
[2] It's not great for gaming. Platforms like battle.net and Steam have come
up with mac versions of their same games, but its not as good as the windows
versions, but very manageable.  
[3] It excellent for coding and presentations. It compiles code and runs heavy
tasks without any issue.  
[4] It looks amazing and has a nice screen size. It comes with charger. I
bought a case separately.  
Overall I highly recommend it.
